content.description:
IMAGE 1: AL-AQSA MOSQUE AND THE DOME OF THE ROCK, JERUSALEM

Source: Pixabay

IMAGE 2: MAHABODHI TEMPLE COMPLEX, BODH GAYA, INDIA

Source: Wikimedia Foundation

The images show two culturally significant locations. Jerusalem is a pilgrimage site for adherents of Islam, and Bodh Gaya is a pilgrimage site for followers of Buddhism.
content.question:
A. Describe TWO characteristics of the cultural landscape shown in Image 2.

B. Explain how the spread of Islam from its culture hearth is an example of expansion diffusion.

C. Explain how the global spatial pattern of Buddhism differs from the global spatial pattern of ethnic religions such as Judaism.

D. Explain a likely economic effect of pilgrimages on the location shown in Image 2.

E. Explain the degree to which religion may contribute to devolutionary pressures within the location shown in Image 1.
